title: See the Instagram Accounts You Recently Followed

steps.title: Open Instagram.
steps.content: Open Instagram. On your device, enter the Instagram app.

steps.title: Go to your profile.
steps.content: Go to your profile. Once in the app, tap on the profile icon on the bottom right corner of your screen. [1] X Research source If you have a profile photo, this icon appears as your picture. If you do not yet have a profile photo, this icon will appear as the silhouette of a person.

steps.title: Click on "Following".
steps.content: Click on "Following". At the top of your profile, you will see your number of posts, followers , and accounts following . Click on the number above Following to access a list of all the users you follow. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap on the two arrows.
steps.content: Tap on the two arrows. In your following list, you will see an icon of two arrows pointing in opposite directions. [3] X Research source Tap on this icon to change how these accounts are sorted. Your following list is automatically set to Default , which organizes these accounts based on your interaction with them. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Sort by latest date followed.
steps.content: Sort by latest date followed. After tapping on the arrow, you should see a "Sort by" menu. In this menu, select the Date followed: latest option. [5] X Research source Your following list will automatically re-sort to show your recently followed accounts at the top. You can also sort this list to start with the earliest accounts you followed. [6] X Research source If you want to unfollow accounts from this list, simply tap the "Following" box adjacent to their account name. To get more followers post high quality posts consistently. [7] X Research source Mention other users in your posts and tag them. [8] X Research source Get other users to mention you in their posts, share your posts, and to like them. [9] X Research source
